I'm Aether, the college assistant bot.
The college is generally open Monday–Saturday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM. Please check the official calendar for exceptions.
Regular hours are 8am–5pm Monday through Saturday.
For contact details, please visit the college website or contact the main office.
You can find phone numbers and email addresses on the college 'Contact' page.

Our university offers Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, and Electronics & Telecommunication. For details, please check the programs page on the college website.
Available programs include IT, Computer Engineering, Mechanical, Chemical, Civil and EXTC. Visit the academic catalog for syllabi and admission criteria.
Fee details vary by program and year. Please visit the college fee structure page or contact admissions for the latest information.
For up-to-date fee information, check the official fees page on the university website.
You can find the college location and directions on the Contact / Location page of the official website.
See the campus map and directions on our website for exact address and transport options.
Hostel and accommodation details are provided on the student housing page. For fees and application, contact the housing office.
Yes — the college provides hostel facilities. See the housing section on the website for fees and availability.
Upcoming events, seminars, and festivals are listed on the college events calendar. Check the website for dates and registration info.
You can view all planned events on the college events page.
Admission document requirements depend on the program. Please see the admissions page for a checklist and required forms.
Commonly required documents include ID, transcripts, passport photos, and application forms. Refer to the admissions section for complete details.
The campus has multiple buildings with classrooms, labs, and administrative offices. For exact details, see the campus map on the website.
Our main academic building spans several floors; specific building details are available on the campus information page.
Syllabi and timetables are published on the department pages. Students can also request timetables from their coordinators.
Please visit the academic or department page to download syllabi and schedules.
The college library is open from 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM. For more services and digital resources, check the library page on the website.
Yes — there is a central library with study spaces and an online catalog. See the library page for details.
The university has modern infrastructure including IT labs, smart classrooms, an auditorium, and a well-equipped library.
We provide up-to-date facilities and reliable internet access across campus.
Yes — the campus has a canteen offering a variety of affordable meals.
Menu items vary daily. Typical options include local snacks, meals, and beverages — check the canteen notice board or ask the canteen staff.
Placement records and recruiter lists are on the placements page. For recent statistics and company visit schedules, check the placement cell announcements.
Visit the placement page for details about recruiters, average packages, and placement procedures.
HOD names change occasionally. Please check the department page or contact the IT department for the current HOD information.
Please visit the Computer Department page for current HOD contact details and office hours.
HOD information for EXTC is available on the department webpage. Please specify your department for more accurate details.
The principal's details are listed on the administration page. For immediate assistance, contact your department HOD or the main office.
Exam dates and the academic calendar are published on the academics page. Please consult the official calendar for exact dates.
You can find semester timetables and exam schedules on the university announcements page.
Admission procedures and online application links are available on the admissions page. Check required qualifications and deadlines there.
You can apply online through the university admissions portal. See the admissions page for details and documents required.
The university supports several government and merit-based scholarships. Check the scholarships and financial aid page for eligibility and application details.
Visit the scholarships page for the latest list of available scholarships and how to apply.
We provide labs, smart classrooms, an auditorium, a central library, and student services. See the facilities page for full details.
Campus facilities include AC labs, internet access, library resources, and recreational areas.
Seat intake varies by program. Typical intake is 60 students per engineering branch; check the admissions prospectus for exact numbers.
Please refer to the admissions or program pages for the official intake numbers per branch.

patterns: do we have to wear uniform
responses: Uniform and dress code policies are set by the college and published at the start of the academic year. Please check the student handbook or notices for details.
The college hosts several committees (academic, disciplinary, cultural). Check the student affairs page for committees and contact points.
I'm here to answer questions about the college. Let's keep things professional!

Please use respectful language. I'm here to help.
Let's keep the conversation respectful. How can I assist you?
Academic holidays and vacation dates are in the academic calendar published by the university. Check the academic calendar for exact dates.
Your class coordinator will also share the semester schedule and holiday list.
The college supports sports and has facilities for cricket, football, and indoor games. See the sports section for details and contact information.
For information about sports teams and facilities, please visit the sports and recreation page.
You're welcome! Happy to help.
Glad I could assist — anything else I can help with?

patterns: what can you help me with
responses: I can answer common questions about the college (hours, admissions, courses, facilities). For other queries, I'll point you to the right contact or page.
Ask me about admissions, courses, schedules, facilities, or contact information.
The college enforces a strict anti-ragging policy. If you have concerns, contact student affairs or the helpline listed on the website.
We maintain a ragging-free campus and have reporting channels in place.
HODs differ by department. Tell me which department you're interested in (e.g., IT, Computer, Mechanical) and I'll try to help.
Please specify the department and I'll provide the relevant HOD information or point you to the department page.
